item.title: Pat add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, butcher a hog, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, set a bone, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die gallantly. Specialization is for insects." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Pat add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "Black bears rarely attack. But here's the thing. Sometimes they do. All bears are agile, cunning and immensely strong, and they are always hungry. If they want to kill you and eat you, they can, and pretty much whenever they want. That doesn't happen often, but - and here is the absolutely salient point - once would be enough." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Pat add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "We must take sides. Neutrality helps the oppressor, never the victim. Silence encourages the tormentor, never the tormented. Sometimes we must interfere. When human lives are endangered, when human dignity is in jeopardy, national borders and sensitivities become irrelevant. Wherever men and women are persecuted because of their race, religion, or political views, that place must - at that moment - become the center of the universe." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Pat add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "I needed a drink, I needed a lot of life insurance, I needed a vacation, I needed a home in the country. What I had was a coat, a hat and a gun. I put them on and went out of the room." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: Pat add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "It was a blonde. A blonde to make a bishop kick a hole in a stained-glass window." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: Pat add a quote by Colum McCann
item.description: "What was a life anyway? An accumulation of small shelves of incident." -- Colum McCann

item.title: Pat add a quote by Colum McCann
item.description: "Cynicism is easy. An optimist is a braver cynic." -- Colum McCann

item.title: Pat add a quote by Colum McCann
item.description: "Their perfect English accents. As if serving all their vowels on a fine set of tongs." -- Colum McCann

item.title: Pat add a quote by K. E. Douglas
item.description: "Well, you know how you’re always griping at me to stop reading so many disaster stories and science fiction stuff?” “Yeah.” “I never did." -- K. E. Douglas

item.title: Pat add a quote by K E Douglas
item.description: "Take it slow. We want to know what’s ahead before what’s ahead knows we’re here." -- K E Douglas

item.title: Pat add a quote by K E Douglas
item.description:
"Well, you know how you’re always griping at me to stop reading so many disaster stories and science fiction stuff?”
“Yeah.”
“I never did." -- K E Douglas

item.title: Pat add a quote by Kate Atkinson
item.description: "Do not tell secrets to those whose faith and silence you have not already tested." -- Kate Atkinson

item.title: Pat add a quote by Kate Atkinson
item.description: "She had had affairs over the years ... but she had never been pregnant, never been a mother or a wife and it was only when she realized that it was too late, that it could never be, that she understood what it was that she had lost. Pamela's life would go on after she was dead, her descendants spreading through the world like the waters of a delta, but when Ursula died she would simply end. A stream that ran dry." -- Kate Atkinson

item.title: Pat add a quote by Kate Atkinson
item.description: "It was a long time ago now. And it was yesterday." -- Kate Atkinson

item.title: Pat add a quote by Kate Atkinson
item.description: "If people believed in eternal damnation they might not be seizing the day quite so much." -- Kate Atkinson

item.title: Pat add a quote by Kate Atkinson
item.description: "We cannot turn away,” Miss Woolf told her, “we must get on with our job and we must bear witness.” What did that mean, Ursula wondered. “It means,” Miss Woolf said, “that we must remember these people when we are safely in the future.” “And if <i>we</i> are killed?” “Then others must remember <i>us</i>." -- Kate Atkinson
